resources.string: Detects long-press on the navigation bar to launch Circle to Search.
CTS trigger failed. Please ensure the Google app is set as the default assistant.

On Chinese ROM devices (like ColorOS), Google services are often disabled by default.\n\nGo to [Settings] → [Apps] → [App Management], tap the three-dot menu at the top right, select \'Show System\', and ensure both \'Google Play services\' and \'Google Services Framework\' are enabled.

The Circle to Search feature is built into the Google app.\n\nPlease search for the \'Google\' app in the Play Store and install or update it to the latest version. If it\'s already installed, it\'s recommended to open it once to complete its initial setup.

This app requires temporary system-level permissions (ADB permissions) to bypass system settings.\n\nDownload and install the \'Shizuku\' app from the Play Store or GitHub. Start Shizuku using the \'Wireless Debugging\' feature until it shows \'Running\'. Then tap [Check] below to grant permission.

Circle to Search requires the device\'s Default Digital Assistant to be set to Google.\n\nTap [Apply] below, and this app will use Shizuku permissions to force-change your system\'s digital assistant from Breeno (or others) to Google.

Circle to Search is locked by default in the Google app on Chinese region devices.\n\nTap [Apply] below to modify the internal flags of the Google app using Shizuku permissions. This will forcefully unlock the Circle to Search feature.

If you want to use Google\'s latest AI, Gemini, as your default assistant, install the \'Google Gemini\' app from the Play Store.\n\nIf you skip this, Circle to Search will still work perfectly fine via the standard Google app.

Choose how you want to interact with Circle to Search.

[Long-press Navbar (Recommended)]
Creates an invisible overlay at the bottom so you can long-press the home bar just like on native devices.

[Quick Settings Tile]
Adds a button to your notification drop-down menu.

You can change this anytime in the app settings later.
You can now use Circle to Search.
